|footnotes = }} Kitwe is the second largest city in size and population in the country Zambia. Kitwe has a population of 504,194 (2010 census). Kitwe was found in 1936 as the railway line was being built by Cecil Rhodes' company. The city is home to a number of mining operations including the Mopani Copper Mines. ==Twin towns – sister cities== Kitwe's has five Twin towns and sister cities: * - Baia Mare, Romania * - Bor, Serbia * - Sheffield, South Yorkshire, England, United Kingdom * - Detroit, Michigan, United States * - Ponta Grossa, Paraná, Brasil == Other websites == * Historical, vector-based map of Nkana-Kitwe, 1961 ==Reference== Category:Cities in Zambia Category:Copperbelt
